arlut.csd.ganymede.server
Class XMLTransmitter

java.lang.Object
  arlut.csd.ganymede.server.XMLTransmitter
All Implemented Interfaces:
FileTransmitter, java.rmi.Remote
public final class XMLTransmitter
extends java.lang.Object
implements FileTransmitter

This class is used on the server to act as a FileTransmitter, a client pulling data to do an xmlclient dump can make iterative calls on this object over RMI in order to receive the file.

Constant Field Values

ts

static final TranslationService ts
TranslationService object for handling string localization in the Ganymede server.

bufferSize

static final int bufferSize
How big should the buffer between the XML dumping thread and the getNextChunk() method in this class? This can be up to 64k, and the larger it is up to that limit, the fewer RMI calls will be required to pull a large XML dump from Ganymede.

See Also:

Constructor Detail

XMLTransmitter

public XMLTransmitter(boolean sendData,
                      boolean sendSchema,
                      java.lang.String syncChannel,
                      boolean includeHistory,
                      boolean includeOid)
               throws java.io.IOException,
                      java.rmi.RemoteException
This constructor creates the XMLTransmitter used to send XML dump data from the Ganymede server down to the xmlclient. A XMLTransmitter serves as an RMI exported object that the xmlclient can continually poll to download chunks of XML.

Throws:
java.io.IOException
java.rmi.RemoteException

XMLTransmitter

public XMLTransmitter(GanymedeSession session,
                      Query query,
                      QueryResult rows)
               throws java.io.IOException,
                      java.rmi.RemoteException
This constructor creates the XMLTransmitter used to send Ganymede query result data from the Ganymede server down to the xmlclient. A XMLTransmitter serves as an RMI exported object that the xmlclient can continually poll to download chunks of XML.

Throws:
java.io.IOException
java.rmi.RemoteException
Method Detail

getNextChunk

public byte[] getNextChunk()
                    throws java.rmi.RemoteException
This method pulls down the next sequence of bytes from the FileTransmitter. This method will block if necessary until the data is ready to be transmitted. This method returns null on end of file.

Specified by:
getNextChunk in interface FileTransmitter
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException

end

public void end()
         throws java.rmi.RemoteException
This method is called to notify the FileTransmitter that no more of the file will be pulled.

Specified by:
end in interface FileTransmitter
Throws:
java.rmi.RemoteException
